items.summary: Firefighting conditions have improved around the fire that burnt through properties near the town of Gellibrand in Victoria's south-west, but crews warn the blaze is still not under control.

items.title: Amazon accidentally announces further 16,000 layoffs in AI pivot
items.summary: A misfired internal email was the first time many employees found out about a second round of job cuts in just six months.

items.title: Concerns domestic tenants required to share excessive personal data to secure leases
items.summary: Tenants are being forced to hand over excessive personal data when applying for rental properties, with new research warning that applicants' personal information could be at risk.

items.title: Novak Djokovic gets lucky break in Australian Open win over Lorenzo Musetti
items.summary: As he trailed Lorenzo Musetti, 10-time champion Novak Djokovic knew he was on the ropes as he looked to keep his Australian Open campaign alive.

items.title: Authorities investigate bomb allegedly thrown into Perth Invasion Day rally crowd as 'potential terrorist act'
items.summary: A joint statement by WA Police, the Australian Federal Police and domestic security agency ASIO say the agencies' investigations are ongoing.

items.title: Victorian man faces court over alleged assault in SA
items.summary: A Victorian man has faced court after allegedly stabbing a man before following him to an Adelaide hospital where he allegedly made threats toward paramedics.

items.title: First Nations urge stronger response after alleged Invasion Day rally attack
items.summary: First Nations leaders have urged governments to take stronger action in response to the alleged attack at an Invasion Day rally in Perth on Monday. Social Justice Commissioner Katie Kiss says failing to do so "sends a message that Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people do not matter".

items.title: Gem hunter receives suspended prison sentence for illegally mining turquoise at NT sacred site
items.summary: A gemstone dealer has received a four-month suspended prison sentence for illegally mining more than 8 tonnes of turquoise ore at a Northern Territory sacred site.

items.title: The search for Celine Cremer, Belgian tourist who disappeared in the Tasmanian bush
items.summary: The two-and-a-half year search for a missing Belgian tourist has led to the discovery of bones, which may mean closure is not far away.

items.title: Chinese ambassador announces joint taskforce in hunt for man who threw hot coffee over Brisbane baby
items.summary: China's ambassador to Australia says authorities will travel to Brisbane as the search for the man who threw hot coffee on a baby continues.

items.title: Doctors failed to tell authorities of driver's vision impairment before fatal Adelaide crash, inquest hears
items.summary: A coronial inquest will investigate why three doctors failed to alert relevant authorities that a man was unfit to drive due to vision impairment in the years before he caused a crash which killed a mother of four.

items.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: Police say bones found at a Phillip Island house not linked to active missing persons case
items.summary: Police say human remains found on Phillip Island are not linked to a missing persons investigation, amid community speculation about whether the bones might be linked to an historic cold case.

items.title: Former member of National Socialist Network fights for return of weapons licence
items.summary: A man, who was stripped of more than a dozen guns after police found multiple copies of Adolf Hitler's manifesto at his home, is fighting to have his weapons licence reinstated by a court.

items.title: Former South Korean first lady Kim Keon Hee sentenced to 20 months in jail for corruption
items.summary: Kim Keon Hee, the wife of jailed former South Korean president Yoon Suk Yeol, is sentenced to prison by a Seoul court.

items.title: Chinese ambassador hints at retaliation if Port of Darwin is returned to Australian control
items.summary: China's ambassador to Australia, Xiao Qian, questions the Albanese government's ethics in wanting to return the Port of Darwin to Australian hands.

items.title: Jim Chalmers has rejected responsibility for high inflation but will have a tough sell if rates rise again
items.summary: Less than a year after the Reserve Bank started cutting rates, the prospect of a rate rise is a political nightmare for a treasurer hoping for clear air.

items.title: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Luana brings rain relief for remote WA inland cattle stations
items.summary: Weather associated with a former cyclone has drenched parts of Western Australia's inland region, bringing relief for pastoralists who had received very little rain for the previous 12 months.

items.title: Rain has transformed the outback from parched to puddles.
items.summary: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

items.title: Iranian doctor who fled to Australia after operating on massacre victims estimates death toll in tens of thousands
items.summary: In one of the most harrowing accounts yet, a doctor who fled Iran for Australia recounts trying to save bullet-riddled victims of the government crackdown on protests.

items.title: Alert level downgraded for Bullsbrook bushfire that threatened homes
items.summary: The alert level for a blaze burning north of Perth is downgraded, after it threatened lives and homes on Wednesday afternoon.

items.title: Counterfeit Botox still being imported into Australia, months after regulator first raised alarm
items.summary: Counterfeit Botox vials were packaged in branded boxes that appear like a genuine product, according to a renewed warning from the Therapeutic Goods Administration.

items.title: 'One-off' literary festival, Constellations, to go ahead in lieu of Writers' Week
items.summary: A community literary festival will go ahead in the wake of the cancellation of Adelaide Writers' Week, but those involved say it is not a replacement for the original event.

items.title: Teenager accused of electric motorbike death in Perth's north pleads not guilty to manslaughter charge
items.summary: A teenage boy accused of killing a 59-year-old woman while riding an unlicensed high-powered electric motorbike in Perth's north has pleaded not guilty to manslaughter.

items.title: Wine Australia's export report for 2025 shows consumers sobering up as cost of living bites
items.summary: Global demand for Australian wine is continuing to dwindle, with the latest Wine Australia export report showing an 8 per cent decrease in 2025 as consumers opt for alcohol-free trends.

items.title: Off-contract Usman Khawaja keen to extend Big Bash career with Brisbane Heat
items.summary: In the aftermath of his international retirement, Usman Khawaja is keen to extend his Big Bash career, with his preference to strike a new deal with the Brisbane Heat.

items.title: Remains found during search in Tasmanian bush for missing tourist Celine Cremer
items.summary: The bushwalker who found human remains while searching for missing Belgian tourist Celine Cremer says he "went into shock" after coming across bones in dense Tasmanian forest.

items.title: At least 16 structures lost in Otways fire with heatwave still impacting Victoria's north-east
items.summary: At least 16 structures have been destroyed by the Carlisle River fire in Victoria's Otways, with a strong wind change late yesterday afternoon impacting another 1,000 hectares.

items.title: Littleproud open to Ley meeting after Nationals spill resolved
items.summary: Nationals Leader David Littleproud will stare down a leadership tilt from Queensland MP Colin Boyce, though colleagues say it is unlikely the challenger will secure enough votes for a spill.

items.title: Why UFC 325 is a collision between Alex Volkanovski's glorious past and uncertain future
items.summary: An end of an era looms for Alex Volkanovski as he prepares for his first title defence on home soil, but ahead of UFC 325, Australia's greatest ever MMA fighter is still the nation's gold standard.

items.title: Mass wildlife rescue underway with flying foxes entangled at golf club driving range
items.summary: A mass wildlife rescue is again underway at the Noosa Golf Club after dozens of flying foxes became trapped in netting at its driving range for the fourth time this month.

items.title: Leigh Geoffrey Sushames pleads guilty to murder of Tasmania Police Constable Keith Smith
items.summary: The man accused of fatally shooting Tasmania Police Constable Keith Smith pleads guilty to murder in a Devonport court.

items.title: 'Doomsday Clock' set to 85 seconds to midnight, closer than ever to catastrophe
items.summary: Atomic scientists set the Doomsday Clock to 85 seconds midnight, with threats such as nuclear weapons and conflicts pushing humanity closer than ever to the point of annihilation.

items.title: Tourist mauled by snow leopard while trying to take photo, Chinese media reports
items.summary: A female skier has been mauled by a snow leopard on her way back to her hotel in China after she attempted to get a selfie.

items.title: Accessory to murder charges dropped in cold case of NSW mother Pauline Sowry
items.summary: Leon Boeyen, who has been in prison since May on two charges relating to the 1993 disappearance of the NSW woman, wept as he learned he would be released.

items.title: Cattle farmer rescues koala from bushfire

items.title: Hoodoo Gurus' Dave Faulkner lashes One Nation use of song at March for Australia Rally
items.summary: Faulkner says One Nation and its supporters can "take a running jump" after his band's song was used at an Australia Day rally held by the party, and he's not bothered by party supporters trolling him on social media.

items.title: Woman accused of paying secret kickbacks to surgeons to use medical devices at Brisbane hospital faces court
items.summary: The finance manager is one of four people who were charged last month, following an investigation involving the Crime and Corruption Commission and the Queensland Office of the Health Ombudsman.

items.title: Accidental 'crying horse' toy becomes Spring Festival bestseller in China
items.summary: A dour-faced toy horse — the result of a manufacturing error — has gone viral in China, with some workers saying its expression mirrors their long hours and workplace stress.

items.title: Microplastics triple in Sydney's waterways in three years, report finds
items.summary: Microplastic pollution on Sydney's beaches and harbour shorelines has tripled in the past three years, according to a report, much of it from sources of "preventable losses".

items.title: Coco Gauff backed by Iga Świątek after smashing racquet at Australian Open
items.summary: Iga Świątek defends Coco Gauff after footage was shown of the American smashing a racquet at the Australian Open.

items.title: Tony Abbott intervenes in Liberal leadership battle calling on right to unite to oust Sussan Ley
items.summary: Former prime minister Tony Abbott has intervened in the Liberal leadership race, urging conservatives to unite behind either Angus Taylor or Andrew Hastie in their bid to oust Sussan Ley from the top job.

items.title: Why haven't police labelled Perth's Invasion Day rally incident terrorism? Here's what we know
items.summary: Identifying ideological motivations behind attacks is critical to separating terrorism from other events just designed to cause fear, an extremism expert told the ABC.

items.title: Man charged with hate speech Brandan Koschel had posted photos alongside Neo-Nazis
items.summary: Brandan Koschel had posted blurred images of himself standing next to prominent Neo-Nazis on a social media account earlier this month.

items.title: Daylesford crash driver will be compelled to give evidence at inquest, coroner rules
items.summary: A Victorian coroner has ruled that a driver with diabetes who ploughed into a crowd outside a regional pub, killing five people, will be compelled to give evidence at an inquest.

items.title: Mount Lawley diamond jewellery shop targeted in suspected ram raid
items.summary: Thieves target a Mount Lawley jewellery store in an early morning ram raid, leaving empty cabinets and a trail of destruction.

items.title: Tongans frustrated with Trump's 'collective punishment' of foreign nationals
items.summary: The United States bars Tongans from short-term visits or travel for tourism and business purposes, saying too many are overstaying their visas.

items.title: Liberal frontbencher says Morrison's proposal to register imams 'a worthwhile discussion'
items.summary: Liberal frontbencher Andrew Bragg says Australian Muslims need to take some responsibility for extremist incidents and that a proposal for a register of Islamic preachers is worth considering.

items.title: Diamonds call up Matilda Garrett for Jamaica series as Australia eyes Commonwealth Games
items.summary: Australia's netball hierarchy settles on a replacement for an injured defender ahead of the Diamonds' three-Test series against Jamaica.

items.title: TikTok settles social media addiction lawsuit ahead of trial against Meta, YouTube
items.summary: TikTok agrees to settle a landmark lawsuit on social media addiction, the same day the trial was due to start against Meta and YouTube.

items.title: University of Southern Queensland astronomer discovers 'potentially habitable' planet candidate
items.summary: An international team of astronomers led from regional Queensland finds an exoplanet 150 light-years away with a 50 per cent chance of having liquid water on its surface.

items.title: Meet the 2026 Trailblazers changing regional Australia
items.summary: Jayden is helping youth go from feeling "lost, angry and unheard" to "proud strong and seen". He's one of our 2026 Trailblazers, announced today.

items.title: Busselton ratepayers set to foot $60 million bill after performing arts centre cost blowout
items.summary: Residents demand answers after the cost of a performing arts centre in the state's South West more than tripled its original allocated budget.

items.title: Floor collapse at Toll warehouse causes statewide vaccine shortages
items.summary: A section of floor has caved-in at Queensland's only vaccine warehouse, causing statewide delays to childhood vaccination schedules.

items.title: Judge orders ICE head to face court as Trump shakes up Minnesota operation
items.summary: A Minnesota judge takes the extraordinary step of ordering the acting director of Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) to appear in person and explain why his agency keeps ignoring court orders.

items.title: Carlos Alcaraz approaching 'unmatchable' level after mastering powers of concentration
items.summary: Twelve months ago, Carlos Alcaraz was outwitted by a hobbled Novak Djokovic. This time around, against a rampaging hometown hero, there would be no slipping up.

items.title: Rado Vidisic, A-League title winning coach and Australian football figure, dies aged 64
items.summary: Rado Vidosic, a highly-regarded Australian football figure and coach across a number of A-League clubs and teams, dies of cancer aged 64.

items.title: 'Incredibly abnormal' temperatures 20C above average in parts of Australia — as it happened
items.summary: Towns in New South Wales and Queensland are sweltering today amid a record-breaking heatwave, as firefighters continue to battle multiple blazes in Victoria.

items.title: Sydney Festival 2026: Our favourite shows from Lacrima to Wake
items.summary: A debauched Irish wake, a three-hour French play about a royal wedding dress and British electro-pop band Hot Chip were some of the best of the festival.

items.title: Documents reveal widespread misconduct, complaints, at Busy Bees childcare centres in Canberra
items.summary: Disturbing allegations of verbal and physical mistreatment of toddlers, poor supervision and repeated staffing failures have emerged in documents about Busy Bees childcare centres in Canberra.

items.title: Alex de Minaur receives feedback from Carlos Alcaraz after Australian Open loss
items.summary: Alex de Minaur acknowledges he needs improvement in his game, as Carlos Alcaraz moves on to the Australian Open semifinals.

items.title: Scientists warn microplastics testing could be overestimating extent in human body
items.summary: Queensland researchers lead calls for a standardised approach to microplastics testing, amid growing concerns about the impact of the pollutants on the human body.

items.title: Andrew and Tristan Tate lose bid to sue Adelaide YouTuber, launch appeal
items.summary: An Australian YouTuber who is being sued by Andrew and Tristan Tate in a Florida court has won a bid to have the case dismissed, a decision the self-described misogynist influencers are now appealing.

items.title: Sydney's landfills are set to reach capacity by 2030 sparking controversial plans to take trash to the regions
items.summary: A proposal to build an incinerator in the regional town of Parkes could see 700,000 tonnes of Sydney's red bin rubbish transported there every year.

items.title: Search for alleged triple murderer Julian Ingram may be like 'finding a needle in a haystack'
items.summary: A former deputy commissioner of police who was involved in the eight-year search for one of Australia's most notorious fugitives says finding alleged Lake Cargelligo triple murderer Julian Ingram will be difficult.

items.title: Australia's heatwave smashes temperature records with some places nearing 50C
items.summary: The Australian Open is off to a cooler start today after parts of Melbourne buckled under 45-degree heat yesterday, in a heatwave setting historic temperature records across the country's south-east.

items.title: Albanese government turns defence sights north, completing $355m upgrade to RAAF Base Tindal
items.summary: A Royal Australian Air Force base near Katherine in the NT is updated with purpose-built hangars and improved runways.
